title: datalad install - unrecognized argument: --no-patch
body:
#### What is the problem?
```
[dorian@mri ~]$ datalad install -J 3 -r -g ///dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms/bids_test4-20161014
install(notneeded): /home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014 (dataset) [dataset <Dataset path=/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014> was already cloned from 'http://datasets.datalad.org/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms/bids_test4-20161014']
[INFO   ] Installing <Dataset path=/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014> recursively
[INFO   ] Cloning http://datasets.datalad.org/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-1/.git to '/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-1'
[ERROR  ] Installation of subdatasets <Dataset path=/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-1> failed with exception: CommandError: command '['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'show', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', 'master', '--']' failed with exitcode 128
Failed to run ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'show', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', 'master', '--'] under u'/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-1'. Exit code=128. out= err=fatal: unrecognized argument: --no-patch
 [gitrepo.py:get_hexsha:1189] [install(/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-1)]
[INFO   ] Cloning http://datasets.datalad.org/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-2/.git to '/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-2'
[ERROR  ] Installation of subdatasets <Dataset path=/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-2> failed with exception: CommandError: command '['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'show', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', 'master', '--']' failed with exitcode 128
Failed to run ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'show', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', 'master', '--'] under u'/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-2'. Exit code=128. out= err=fatal: unrecognized argument: --no-patch
 [gitrepo.py:get_hexsha:1189] [install(/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-2)]
[INFO   ] Cloning http://datasets.datalad.org/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-3/.git to '/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-3'
[ERROR  ] Installation of subdatasets <Dataset path=/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-3> failed with exception: CommandError: command '['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'show', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', 'master', '--']' failed with exitcode 128
Failed to run ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'show', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', 'master', '--'] under u'/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-3'. Exit code=128. out= err=fatal: unrecognized argument: --no-patch
 [gitrepo.py:get_hexsha:1189] [install(/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-3)]
[INFO   ] Cloning http://datasets.datalad.org/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-4/.git to '/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-4'
[ERROR  ] Installation of subdatasets <Dataset path=/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-4> failed with exception: CommandError: command '['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'show', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', 'master', '--']' failed with exitcode 128
Failed to run ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'show', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', 'master', '--'] under u'/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-4'. Exit code=128. out= err=fatal: unrecognized argument: --no-patch
 [gitrepo.py:get_hexsha:1189] [install(/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-4)]
[INFO   ] Cloning http://datasets.datalad.org/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-5/.git to '/home/dorian/bids_test4-20161014/phantom-5'
^CERROR:
Interrupted by user while doing magic: KeyboardInterrupt() [subprocess.py:_communicate_with_poll:1455]
```

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
`datalad install -J 3 -r -g ///dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms/bids_test4-20161014`

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
Maybe that git was recently updated to fix a security bug.

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
First attempt.
